tr.td: For enabling Justices of Peace to build andrepair Gaols in their respective Counties.
Justices of the Peace, upon Presentmentas herein mentioned, to agree upon Sum of Money necessary for building Gaol, and to charge the same.—Quarter Sessions to direct Precepts for levying the same.
Persons neglecting, &c. to pay Assessments, or conveying away Goods, &c. Collectors may distrain; and if Assessment not paid within Four Days, Distress to be sold, &c.
Justices under Hand and Seal to appoint a Receiver.
Receiver or other Officer refusing to account, Justices may commit to Prison until Account.
Receipt of Receivers a Discharge to Constables, &c.; and Discharge by Justices a Release of Receiver in all Courts, &c.
Justices empowered to agree for building of Gaols.
Sheriff to have the keeping of such Gaols.
Proviso for common Gaols of Inheritance, &c.
Proviso for Inhabitants of Places which have common Gaols as herein mentioned.
In Action brought for executing Act, General Issue may be pleaded—Treble Costs.
No Alienation of Lands belonging to theCrown upon which Gaols are situate.
Distress not to be made in Mansions of Peers.

Continuance of Act.
This Act continued, 10 Ann. c. 14. § 2. which is made perpetual, 6 G. I. c. 19. § 1.; and see 12 G. II. c. 29. and this Act explained and amended,24 G. III. Sess. 2. c. 54.

entry.head: Glass Wares and Stone and Earthen Bottles See Customs. Ercise.
Goods and Merchanoize erported and Imported See Customs. Exportation. Importation.

tr.td:
Whale Fins, Oil, and Blubber imported by Greenland Company not liable to Duty of 12d. under Stat. 8 & 9 W. III. c. 24.– 9 W. III. c. 23.
By 26 G. III. c. 41. § 14. Whale Fins, Blubber, &c. may be imported as there-in mentioned, Duty-free — continued until 25th Dec. 1799, 38 G. III. c. 35.§ 4.– See 27 G. III. c. 13. Sch. A. In-wards, tit. Whale Fins.—43 G. III.c. 68. § 1. and Sch. A. Inwards, tit. Oil.—49 G. III. c. 98. § 1. and Sch.A. Inwards, tit. Oil, Whale Fins.
See Customs.
For the better Encouragement of the Green-land Trade.
Remainder of £82,000 subscribed, to be paid into the joint Stock as herein men-tioned.
Company not to pay Duty for Oil, &c.imported in the Company's Ships.
Proviso for additional Grants of the Crown of Ground for enlarging, &c.
The Money appropriated for the Year 1699 to be also appropriated as herein mentioned.
